14. A preview of what immediately follows. The goal of this § 7 is to arrive at the phenomenological concept of a phenomenon. But that requires further precision
• regarding the formal and ordinary concept of phenomenon, and particularly
• regarding how that formal concept operates in the ordinary activity of making sense of things.
We make sense of things through what the Greeks called logos. In the following subsection, we discuss what logos means, with the goal of finding out how phenomenology can come to be a “science” of phenomena.
